For unlimited add "0" without quotes.

user_setting_fevent_sponsor_price:
How much is the sponsor space worth for events?
This works in a CPM basis.
user_setting_auto_publish_sponsored_item:
After the user has purchased a sponsored space, should the event be published right away?
If set to false, the admin will have to approve each new purchased sponsored event space before it is shown in the site.
user_setting_flood_control_events:
How many minutes should a user wait before they can create another event?

Note: Setting it to "0" (without quotes) is default and users will not have to wait.

active_calendar_api_service:
Active Calendar API service (Get API key)
  • Open Services page
  • On Calendar API, click on Status button to activate this service
  • Check "I agree to these terms" and click Accept button twice time to accept 2 terms of service
  • On Calendar API, Off button change to On button => Turn on successful
create_an_oauth_client_id:
Create an OAuth 2.0 client ID (Get Client ID and Client secret)
  • Go to API Access
  • Click on Create an OAuth 2.0 client ID
  • Input Product Name and click Next button
  • Choose Web Application type
  • At Your Site or hostname setting, click (more options) link
  • Copy and paste this link: {RedirectUri} to Authorized Redirect URIs
  • Copy and paste this link: {CoreHost} to Authorized JavaScript Origins
  • Click Create client ID to complete.
get_google_api_detail:
Get Google API detail
  • Insert the Client ID, Client secret and API key values into this form.
  • Click Submit button to complete.

email_newsletter_events_will_be_started_: Email newsletter: events will be started within {within_day} days
active_calendar_api_service_new:
Active Calendar API service (Get API key)
  • In project Dashboard, click on Enable and manage APIs page
  • Choose Google Apps APIs >> Calendar API
  • Click on Enable API button to activate this service
  • Click on Credentials in left menu
  • Under section APIs Credentials, click on Add credentials button and select API Key
  • On the popup click the button Server Key and click Create
create_an_oauth_client_id_new:
Create an OAuth 2.0 client ID (Get Client ID and Client secret)
  • Open Credentials >> OAuth consent screen page
  • Input Product name shown to users,Email and click Save button
  • Open Credentials page, under section APIs Credentials, click on Add credentials button and select OAuth 2.0 client ID
  • Choose Web Application type
  • Copy and paste this link: {CoreHost} to Authorized JavaScript Origins
  • Copy and paste this link: {RedirectUri} to Authorized Redirect URIs
  • Click Create client ID to complete
setting_fevent_number_of_event_upcoming_: <title>Number of Events For Upcoming Events, Past Events Block on Right Side.</title><info>Number of Events For Upcoming Events, Past Events Block on Right Side.</info>
this_event_and_all_following_events: This event and all following events
following_events_desc: Apply for this instance and all upcoming events in this series
all_events_desc: Apply for all instances in this series, included this instance, upcoming and past events

setting_fevent_meta_keywords: Meta keywords that will be displayed on sections related to the Advanced Events app. To edit this setting, please go to AdminCP > Globalization > Phrases, search and edit phrase have var name is: "seo_fevent_meta_keywords"
setting_fevent_meta_description: Meta description added to pages related to the Advanced Events app. To edit this setting, please go to AdminCP > Globalization > Phrases, search and edit phrase have var name is: "seo_fevent_meta_description"
setting_fevent_display_event_created_in_: <title>Display events which created in Group to the All Events page at the Advanced Events app</title><info>Enable to display all public events to the both Advanced Events page in group detail and All Events page in Advanced Events app. Disable to display events created by an users to the both Advanced Events page in group detail and My Events page of this user in Advanced Events app and nobody can see these events in Advanced Events app but owner.</info>

<title>Display events which created in Page to the All Events page at the Advanced Events app</title><info>Enable to display all public events to the both Advanced Events page in page detail and All Events page in Advanced Events app. Disable to display events created by an users to the both Advanced Events page in page detail and My Events page of this user in Advanced Events app and nobody can see these events in Advanced Events app but owner.</info>
